errors.error_description: The `pip install` command uses an incorrect package name `spot` instead of `spotpy`, which will cause the installation to fail or install the wrong package.
The `conda install` command `conda spotpy install` has incorrect syntax. The package name should follow the `install` subcommand.
The `pip install` command pins the package to version `1.4.0`, which is an old version and may not be compatible with modern environments or contain the latest features.
The link to the examples in the 'Getting started' section is incorrect. It points to `.../tree/master/examples` but the correct path is `.../tree/master/spotpy/examples`.
correction_candidates: Change the link to the main repository page: https://github.com/thouska/spotpy/
